vocabInfos.lsjDefs:
διαθήκη, ἡ,
(διατίθημι) disposition of property by will, testament, [Refs 5th c.BC+]; κατὰ διαθήκην by will, [Refs 1st c.BC+], etc.: in plural, διαθήκας διαθέσθαι [Refs 5th c.BC+]
__II αἱ ἀπόρρητοι δ. mystic deposits on which the common weal depended, probably oracles (compare διαθέτης), [Refs 4th c.BC+]
__II.2 name of an eyesalve, because the recipe was deposited in a temple, [Refs 6th c.AD+]
__III compact, covenant, ἢν μὴ διαθῶνται διαθήκην ἐμοί [LXX+5th c.BC+]; καινή, παλαιὰ δ., [NT]; disposition (with allusion to [NT]
__IV ={διάθεσις}[Refs 3rd c.AD+]
vocabInfos.shortDef: covenant, a solemn agreement between two parties; will, testament, a legal document by which property is transferred to heirs, usually upon death (<ref='Heb.9.16'>Heb 9:16</ref>)
vocabInfos.mediumDef:
covenant, a solemn agreement between two parties; will, testament, a legal document by which property is transferred to heirs, usually upon death (Heb 9:16)
a testamentary disposition, will; a covenant, Heb. 9:16, 17; Gal. 3:15; in NT, a covenant of God with men, Gal. 3:17; 4:24; Heb. 9:4; Mt. 26:28; the writings of the old covenant, 2Cor. 3:14
vocabInfos._es_Definition: convenio, pacto; pl. ordenanzas, decretos (de un convenio) o sencillamente convenio ; voluntad, testamento (GAL.3:15); ambos pacto y testamento (HEB.9:16,17; GAL.3:17)
vocabInfos._zh_tw_Definition:
1) 最後的意願與約定
2) 盟約
3) 契約
vocabInfos._zh_Definition:
1) 最后的意愿与约定
2) 盟约
3) 契约
